Package eventorganizer

Class EventCalendar

java.lang.Object
eventorganizer.EventCalendar
public class EventCalendar extends Object
Creates an EventCalendar, which holds a list of events and the # of events present Performs all the adding, removing, and printing operations
Author:
Palak Singh, Daniel Guan

  • Constructor Details

    • EventCalendar

      EventCalendar(Event[] events, int numEvents)
      Constructor to make a EventCalendar
      Parameters:
      events - list containing all the events
      numEvents - how many events are currently in the list (note: not equivalent to hoe many events are in the list)

    • find

      private int find(Event event)
      Finding a specific event in the list
      Parameters:
      event - we are trying to find in the list
      Returns:
      int index at which the event is present, -1 if the event is not found

    • grow

      private void grow()
      Adds 4 additions spots at the end of the list

    • add

      public boolean add(Event event)
      Adds the event to the next null space If there is no space left, it grows 4 more spaces and then adds to the list
      Parameters:
      event - that we want to add to the list
      Returns:
      true once the event is successfully added to the list

    • remove

      public boolean remove(Event event)
      Removing a given event from the list
      Parameters:
      event - that we are trying to remove from the list
      Returns:
      true if the method removes the event, false if even doesn't exist in the list

    • contains

      public boolean contains(Event event)
      Checks to see if a given event is in the list
      Parameters:
      event - that we are looking for in the list
      Returns:
      boolean true is the event is found, false if the event is not in the list

    • print

      public void print()
      Events are printed out just as they appear in the list

    • swap

      private void swap(int a, int b)
      Swaps two events in the array, given the two indices you want to swap

      public void printByDate()
      Sorts and prints the events organized by date, earliest to latest, relative from today's date
